page.title: 14TRANSPORT 3
page.content:
{CANALS} There is one canal in this area, the "Leeds to Liverpool" canal. In the past it was used to transport goods produced at the mills, but is now just used for pleasure cruising. The main craft on the canal are barges, although it isn't exactly speed for fun as there is a 4 m.p.h. speed restriction on the whole length of the canal! A typical journey from Accrington to Liverpool could be made in l6 hours provided you get through the locks quickly.
David Moorcroft Rhyddings High School
